comments:
Use of ? in Dataset's Qery editor causes an error.
using '?' solves the editing problem, however the query will not wotk any more.
The only work around is to use '?' and hit close the window, then change '?' to ? within the property-editor. This has been tested for DateTime fields
Example query:

Select * from race_runs where start_time > ?

This has worked in 2.01

I've tested queries as listed above in my local environment but can see no problem. Can you check your report design so that to make sure the input "?" is a standard ASCII "?" rather than "?"s from some IME? If you find no problem about the "?" please provide your report design which can reproduce the bug in your machine.

Thanks.

Joint Dataset example

Please see this file as an axample for error caused by enterinf ? in query.
Try to modify the sql and save again. It will cause an error. Only quoted question mark like '?' works in Editor.

The Editor is realy bugy im my enviroment (2.1 29/06/2006)
1. Entering a Question Mark will cause error. No OK button works any more.
2. Save the file in XML source view will destroy the file, so it can not be opened again.
3. Using '?' instead of ? in query will caus error in joint datasets.
4. Joint dataset do not show and use underlaying dataset parameters.

I should mention, editing the report in XML view and savint it will remove ascii code C2 from the file (e.g. in copyright remark etc.)
This causes that the report can not be loaded any more.

Becasue I couldn't get your database, I attach one report file with the parameter place holder using sampledb. Could you please try it to verify if the error still exist? If there still has error, could you please attach the error log?Thanks.

Use this files (Mysql Database Dump and related Report).
Follow this steps:

1) run the sql query 
2) open the Report
3) change the DataSource entries if not using mysql on localhost
4) edit "scen" dataset and modify the SQL (e.g. add a new field to the query
5) press "OK" (it will not work)
6) klick on "Parameters or othe menu-entry (left) -> Error!
7) change the Query and use '?' instead of ?
8) OK Works!
9) right click on "scen" dataset and choose properties
10) change the query in properties und enter ? instead of '?' (only way ...)
------------------------------------------------------
11) drag a Chart on Report
12) unse in "Select Data" the "joinds" entry
13) klick on Parameters -> No Parameter available! but there should be one!
("scen" Dataset has one!)

If I had a clerical error when I modify your sql text in dataset editor , there is an error thrown like this:
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at com.mysql.jdbc.ResultSetMetaData.getField(ResultSetMetaData.java:381)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.ResultSetMetaData.getColumnType(ResultSetMetaData.java:259)
	at com.mysql.jdbc.MysqlParameterMetadata.getParameterType(MysqlParameterMetadata.java:80)
	at org.eclipse.birt.report.data.oda.jdbc.ParameterMetaData.getParameterType(ParameterMetaData.java:134)
	at org.eclipse.datatools.connectivity.oda.design.ui.designsession.DesignSessionUtil.toDataSetParametersDesign(DesignSessionUtil.java:484)
	at org.eclipse.birt.report.data.oda.jdbc.ui.editors.SQLDataSetEditorPage.mergeParameterMetaData(SQLDataSetEditorPage.java:562)
I've checked the error stack and found it's the mysql driver which throw the NPE. I guess it might be a bug of mysql driver. My tested driver is mysql-connector-java-5.0.0-beta-bin.jar.So Do you use the same driver or have the same error stack? Thanks.

I've reported a bug to mysql. You can trace it from  http://bugs.mysql.com/bug.php?id=21267. Thanks!
I wonder why i can change the sql in property editor without having this problem

In property editor, it will not retrieve the parameter metadata from driver, so the error does not exist. From deep investigation, I think we should not stop user's following operation just because there is unexpected exception thrown by JDBC Driver. So when there is exception in retrieving parameter metadata, we will encapsule the unexpected exception in JDBCException, which will never stop the user's other operation.
